posts.name: rod@3711
posts.cooked:
Playing with WPILIBPI vision processing and having difficulty displaying camera image on Shuffleboard.

Tried making WPILIBPI a server.  rpi Camera is listed in Shuffleboard, but when I drag it to the Shuffleboard window, it is a black image and does not update.

Tried making WPILIBPI a client of RoboRio and again Shuffleboard does not show a live image.

To make things more frustrating, I got it to go live once by hitting the Record/Stop Record button at the bottom of the Shuffleboard screen, but that only worked once.

We have used multiple rpi 3b, multiple win10 computers, multiple SD cards, multiple cameras and have spent multiple hours.

Shuffleboard version 2021.3.1 WPILIBPI version v2021.3.1

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
First, can you see the camera stream in the browser through the Pi’s web config page?

If Shuffleboard is set up to connect to the Rio, the Pi should be set up to be a client (with the team number set).  The Pi should only be set up as a server if Shuffleboard is configured to connect directly to the Pi, rather than the Rio.  I’m assuming you also have code running on the Rio during this testing.

The OutlineViewer tool can be used to verify the stream settings in NetworkTables.  Look under the /cameraPublisher/rpi camera/streams key, it should be a list of strings with IP addresses.  Do the IP addresses match the Pi’s IP address?

posts.name: rod@3711
posts.cooked:
Thanks for response. The camera or cameras do show live images with the PI’s Web Config.  That all works as expected.

When I set up WPILIBPI as server and Set the Net Tables in Shuffleboard to wpilibpi.local, the camera or cameras are listed, but when drug to the Shuffleboard desktop, the image is not updated.

When I set up WPILIBPI as client, the Setup Shuffleboard to follow RoboRio, it works the same.  The Camera Servers are listed, but no live image.

Not familiar with onlineViewer.  It appears to list same camera properties as shown in Shuffleboard.  The Streams Key shows the following: mjpg: http://wpilibpi.local:1181/?action=stream mjpg: http://169.254.82.31:1181/?action=stream

when I ping wpilibpi.local the reply is from 169.254.82.31

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: Only other thing to check is firewalls / web filter type settings.  It sounds like Shuffleboard is getting the correct stream addresses (you can test the stream http URLs in a browser to triple-check), but for some reason isn’t successfully getting the actual video even though your browser is able to do so.  If it’s not firewalls, it’s a bug on the Shuffleboard side.

posts.name: rod@3711
posts.cooked:
Seems to be a Shuffleboard issue.  I had always been starting Shuffleboard with a shuffleboard.json file that had lots of stuff defined.  I deleted that one and started Shuffleboard with a blank sheet.  Drug rPi Cam onto the sheet and it still did not go live.  When I hit the Record/Stop Record button at bottom of Shuffleboard sheet, the image went live.  I stopped Shuffleboard and saved that layout.  When I restarted, the rPi Cam was still on sheet, but I still had to hit Record/Stop Record button at bottom of Shuffleboard sheet, the image went live.  When I went back to the original json file, the camera image did not ever go live.

Another note is the images goes live, but the properties and controls around the image are still grayed out.

Anyway, the Shuffleboard image displays works well enough for me to continue playing with wpilibpi cameras.

Thank you so much for your help

posts.name: Amicus1
posts.cooked: I can confirm that this works, and I have no clue why.

posts.name: Mark
posts.cooked:
I am having a similar problem, but slightly different.

The rPi video stream is pushing happily to the NT server, and on Laptop#1 i can see the video feed in shuffleboard. Windows defender has been disabled.

On Laptop#2 however,  the video feed is just black. But the rest of the NT entries are updating happily. That PC is using McAfee firewall, and turning the firewall off does not fix it. Are there specific ports that i need to open up in the firewall?

This happens with both the simulator and the robot.

posts.name: Amicus1
posts.cooked: Our current theory is that it’s an error in the camera streaming library. That you got one laptop working is curious.

posts.name: Mark
posts.cooked:
We have 3 laptops that are all working, 1 wasnt, but then we turned off windows defender and it started streaming.

I also have 2 that are not working, both of which have antivirus software, which even if i turn off does not seem to make a difference.

Having a thought here … on the simulator i can see exactly which port is being opened up by shuffleboard. I wonder if setting a specific range of ports to pass through the firewall might help?

posts.name: Mark
posts.cooked:
I checked on opening up specific ports, and I do not think that is the issue. Here is why …

When using the simulator, if the simulator crashes the network table server simulator also goes down. When it does, the various attributes that we are pushing to the NT entries stop updating. BUT, the camera feed continues to stay live …

So, I am postulating that that the Shuffleboard camera feed is pulling from the rPi directly, and since it is still live it is still being updated.

If there is something blocking the live stream, then maybe that i why my 2 other PCs cannot see the feed. I am just not sure what i need to do to correct that.

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
mqshaw:

So, I am postulating that that the Shuffleboard camera feed is pulling from the rPi directly, and since it is still live it is still being updated.

That is correct, dashboards only pull the stream location from NT, the actual stream happens directly from the device.

Can the other PCs see the stream via a web browser (you can use the URL embedded in the streams string array in NT)?

posts.name: Mark
posts.cooked:
On the same machine with shuffleboard connected, i can view the stream using a web browser, but not via shuffleboard. The string was pulled from the NT string array.

image 1330×666 92.2 KB

image 1330×666 92.2 KB

image 1330×666 92.2 KB

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: Try pressing the record button (and then you can stop record) on the Shuffleboard side (the button with a black circle near the bottom of the screen).  This has worked around the issue for several people.  We’re working to isolate and fix this bug for 2022.

posts.name: Mark
posts.cooked:
Yes!!  That worked, thank you.  It took a little while to initiate the negotiation, but now its up!

image 1327×668 105 KB

image 1327×668 105 KB

image 1327×668 105 KB

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked: Are you running the same shuffleboard software version on the working and non-working computers?

posts.name: Mark
posts.cooked:
Great question …

Shuffleboard version information on the laptop that has always worked 2020.3.2   -  built February 21, 2020

Shuffleboard version information on the laptop that has NOT worked, but does with the above fix. 2021.3.1   -  built April 25, 2021

I will have to check the other 2 drivers stations tonight

posts.name: Amicus1
posts.cooked: This lines up with research done by another user “carbotanium” on Discord. It’s an issue with the 2021 version of the CameraServer backend.
